column1: The Purple Pig////This made for a stressful experience for everyone involved. The event turned into a race to sit down and order. Halfway through dinner
column2: the waiter let us know we would be fine to continue ordering past 10pm. The host sat on his phone while we ate
column3: and looked as if he was ready to clock out at a moment's notice. The food was great
column4: and all it took was one person to turn an important milestone into a negative experience. The next time we make it to Chicago
column5: we will not be visiting The Purple Pig. The front of house staff is a position management should not overlook or take for granted.
